moves.1. e4:
alrighty, So, this is Me after being kicked out of Southern Chess trying to build up my rating again.
Dude probably doesn't know that I'm actually stronger than my rating shows.
moves.1... g6: I intended to get out one of the fancy schmancy modern openings out, so I began to ready the flanchetto.
moves.2... Bg7 3. Bc4: I wonder how many people actually fall for that...
moves.4. d3 c6: intent to move ##. ... d5 eventually, forcing his bishop into a useless corner.
moves.5. Nh3: This move always confuses me. Aren't knights supposed to be used near the middle, where they have the most manuverability?
moves.7. Bb5+ Bd7 8. Bxd7+:
If you can't tell, I forced that out of him...
I contemplated 7. ... Nc6 8. ... a6 but I'm satisfied with the overall result.
moves.8... Nxd7 9. O-O Ne7 10. Bg5: I was SO waiting for that. With that, I can score 6 points at least! *in an unenthusiastic cheer* yaaaaay.
moves.10... Bxb2 11. Nf4: Y'know... wouldn't most people have moved the OTHER knight out of the way? for, like, avenging the rook?
moves.11... Qa5:
I did that to:
   Free up my knight from the psuedo-pin he was in.
   Add a defender to the d5 pawn
   Prepare to jack up his bishop (by moving up my pawn)
moves.12. Nxe6: This baffels me... Why would he give up a knight for a pawn if it doesn't really get him an advantage
moves.13. Na3: 'bout time he moved the knight! Sheesh!
moves.15. Re1: This worried me slightly, but then I saw an opening that would blow him to shreds if he took that pawn...
moves.15... Rc8: this made that situation unstable for white. moving the rook away from the back row would cause it pain. MUCH pain.
moves.16. Qe3: lining up for an e-file push?
moves.16... Rc6: the take-over had to be put on hold for e-pawn defense
moves.17. h4: the next few moves on his part confuzzled me! @.@;;
moves.18... Qxa2:
free pawn!
I guess I over looked that one...
moves.19. hxg6: ??? A better move woulda been h6, no? because...
moves.19... hxg6: It just relocked the h-file again for the white king...
moves.20. f4 Nf5: like HECK I'm letting him do that again!
moves.21. Qe5: oh, yeah... that whole queen thing... it was so useless through the game that I forgot about it.
moves.21... O-O: That was to stop a rather annoying Qf6 move, which would've resulted in a checkmate for me or at the very least a loss of my pawn defense
moves.22. Bh6: Qg7 maybe? Bf8? what was this guy thinking?!?
moves.24. Bg5 a6:
it took me the longest to figure out why he didn't take a pawn. Then I realized that they were both defended.
I wanted to be able to move my queen, so that's why I bumped up this pawn.
moves.25. d4: I was waiting for that. I knew it would happen eventually.
moves.25... Nxd4: and there's my responce. My defense, planned 5 moves ahead.
moves.26. Qe5: did he think he would nab my knight?
moves.26... Nxc2: Ya-Ha!! I had just noticed that free pawn there...
moves.27. Rd1 Nb4: I was planning on Nb-c4, forcinf his Queen away, then Qf2
moves.28. Qe3: Tricky Punk. He saw it coming and avoided it!
